fields.name: Usage: /timer set <duration>
fields.value: This command sets a timer for the specified **duration**. The maximum duration is 30 days. Once the timer is set, an id is given, which can be used for other timer commands. There will also be buttons for easy subscription and cancellation of the timer.

fields.name: Usage: /timer set <duration> [message]
fields.value: The timer can be given a **message**. If unspecified, it defaults to "Timer has completed".

fields.name: Usage: /timer list
fields.value: This command will list out your active timers.

fields.name: Usage: /timer subscribe <id>
fields.value: If the timer corresponding to the **id** is another user's, you will also be notified when it completes.

fields.name: Usage: /timer cancel <id>
fields.value: If the timer corresponding to the **id** is yours, the timer will be canceled. Otherwise, you will be unsubscribed from the timer.
